name: superficially
content:
superficially adverb
(NOT REALLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 in a way that seems to be real or important when this is not true or correct: The job I've been offered is superficially appealing, but I think I might find it boring after a while. Superficially, such a change might be considered a good thing.

superficially adverb
(NOT COMPLETELY)
in a way that is not complete and involves only the most obvious things: The arguments were very superficially discussed. Books about professional sports are usually superficially reported and poorly written.

superficially adverb
(ONLY ON SURFACE)
in a way that only affects the surface of something: Maize stems superficially resemble bamboo canes. Anyone who bathes regularly with soap and water may be considered superficially clean.
